title: 107_hr1829
content: The "Full Funding for IDEA Now Act of 2001" aims to provide 40 percent of the national average per pupil expenditure to assist States and local educational agencies in educating children with disabilities, making such funding mandatory. The "Full Funding for IDEA Now Act of 2001" mandates that States receive a minimum grant amount based on the number of children with disabilities receiving special education services and 40 percent of the national average per pupil expenditure. The "Full Funding for IDEA Now Act of 2001" mandates States to receive a minimum grant amount based on the number of children with disabilities in the United States. It clarifies that no individual is entitled to assistance under any State program funded under this part. Additionally, there are conforming amendments to the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act, including the removal of subsection (j) and adjustments to the reservation of funds by the Secretary. The Secretary must use no more than one percent of available funds for this part. Amendments include adjustments to fund reservations and removal of certain subsections. The amendments involve changes to fund reservations and the removal of specific subsections in the legislation. The legislation amendments involve changing fund reservations and removing specific subsections. This includes replacing "appropriated" with "available" in various clauses and subparagraphs. The legislation amendments involve changing fund reservations by replacing "appropriated" with "available" in various clauses and subparagraphs, with an effective date of October 1, 2001.
